intro: Serjania pinnatifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood or pink serjania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink or red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, lance-shaped leaflets, and it produces woody pods that contain seeds. Serjania pinnatifolia is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
